description.narrative: TMEA aims at strengthened regional economic integration in East Africa by focusing on, among other things, more efficient trade procedures and reduction in transport costs for increased competitiveness.

TMEA syftar till stärkt regional ekonomisk integration och ökad handel i Östafrika. Programmet fokuserar på effektivisering av handelsprocedurer och reducering av höga transportkostnader för stärkt konkurrenskraft.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The Swedish support to Trade Mark East Africa (TMEA) Uganda window worked well and despite some problems with delays in delivery , the project made remarkable successes. Being a small team, the TMEA Uganda office was efficient and committed. Governance of the programme functioned well with an active National Oversight Committee (NOC) exerting monitoring and strategic guidance. According to the Results Framework, the main outcome of the project was to increase regional trade competitiveness, upgrading of customs management systems and implementation of private sector and civil society organisations advocacy and capacity building and these are reflected in the 3 Strategic objectives that progressed as follows: Strategic objective 1 (SO1): Increased physical access to markets A number of achievements were registered including: Establishment of trade facilitation infrastructure- One Stop Border Posts (OSBPs) at Mirama Hills, Mutukula and Busia, Elegu. The construction of Mirama Hills road was 90% completed by July 2017. These have addressed the physical barriers that initially hindered efficiency in customs clearances at the boarder posts. On Strategic Objective 2: Enhanced Trade Environment. The objective is likely to be achieved and the following outputs were achieved by June 2016: •Instalment of systems to improve performance of key institutions like Uganda Revenue Authority (URA), Uganda Exports Promotions Board (UEPB), Ministry of Trade, Industry and Cooperatives through implementation of systems like ASYCUDA World, Electronic cargo Tracking, Authorized Economic Operator, Non-tariff reporting systems. These have led to 75% reduction in time for export from 28 to 7Days, Reduction in cost of export by 72% (from USD 2,800 to 780), reduced time of import by 58% (31 to 13 days) and reduced import cost from USD 3,378 to 1,176 (65%). Strategic objective 3: Improved Business Competitiveness.The outputs achieved include: Established five grain quality committees by the Grain Council of Uganda •Establishment of data processing centre •Sensitization on East African Community procedures and processes in Lira and Malaba by Private Sector Foundation Uganda (PSFU) •completion of baseline on to identify Non Tariff Barriers affecting women traders .
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
